|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TC4G63EFR-RDA; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Marvell;88W8997P;M, 88W8997P-NXW2, T1MK050.03JW, 1835 A1P, TW, E005; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad2ac = 867 |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 800, 900, 1000, --> |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "48RAAM01.SGC" and "2019.03.14" are silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
FCC internal photos show only one radio chip in this device, the [[Marvell]] 88W8997P-NXW2. FCC test report documents claim that it supports concurrent 2.4GHz and 5GHz WLAN operation. The product page for the [https://www.marvell.com/wireless/88w8997/ 88W8997] chip says that it provides, "concurrent applications support for a device to have two independent radio links, without compromising the 2x2 MIMO link" which seems to suggest that the single chip could be providing the two concurrent 2x2:2 radio links at 5GHz and 2.4GHz.
Additional models are covered by this FCC entry. The [[Catapult TECH 815-00029]] is also called the ''Madesafe Gateway'' and has an external bluetooth antenna instead of internal. The [[Catapult TECH 815-00028]] is referred to as the ''Madesafe/IOT Gateway'' and it contains an internal module (FCC ID: W7Z-WD907102) which provides Zigbee functionality. <!--FCC documents mention "Test Software Version DutApiMimoBt.exe" recording this in case it later helps identify chipset vendor.-->
[[Category:English Documentation]]
